content.en: Secure Medical Images: Researchers have been exploring the use of algorithms to encrypt medical images and ensure their secure transmission over public networks. These algorithms, based on chaos theory, introduce various techniques such as substitution mechanisms, pixel permutation, masking, swapping sequences, and multiple chaotic maps to improve the security and confidentiality of medical images. By combining chaos and DNA computing, these encryption schemes aim to provide robust security against known attacks and enhance the integrity of medical images in telehealth services.
content.da: Sikrede Medicinske Billeder: Forskere har udforsket brugen af algoritmer til at kryptere medicinske billeder og sikre deres sikre transmission over offentlige netværk. Disse algoritmer, baseret på kaosteori, introducerer forskellige teknikker såsom substitutionsmekanismer, pixel permutation, maskering, byttesekvenser og multiple kaotiske kort for at forbedre sikkerheden og fortroligheden af medicinske billeder. Ved at kombinere kaos og DNA-beregning, sigter disse krypteringsskemaer mod at give robust sikkerhed mod kendte angreb og forbedre integriteten af medicinske billeder i telehelse-tjenester.
